title: Remove git-ops-agent - over-abstraction fragmenting agent responsibilities
description: The git-ops-agent creates unnecessary abstraction by separating git operations from the agents that own the work. Git operations (commit, push, branch) are intrinsic to each agent's responsibility, not a separate concern. Separating them fragments atomic operations and adds coordination overhead without meaningful benefit.
resolution: Deleted git-ops-agent.md and updated all agents to own their git operations. Updated OVERPROMPT templates from 7 phases to 6 phases. Bumped version to 1.2.0.
root_cause: Over-abstraction during initial design - applied delegation pattern where it doesn't fit
acceptance_criteria: retrospective-agent performs its own git operations
work-item-creation-agent keeps optional git commit (backward compatible)
OVERPROMPT templates updated to remove git-ops-agent invocations
FEAT-006 updated to remove git-ops-agent dependency
All agents sync'd to consuming projects after changes
Documentation updated to reflect git operations as agent responsibility
No references to git-ops-agent remain in templates or documentation
